intro: Lepidaploa ehretiifolia, commonly known as the Ehret's leafy lepidaploa, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
